com.siperian.sif.client

Class SiperianClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.client.SiperianClient
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EjbSiperianClient, HttpSiperianClient, SoapSiperianClient

    public abstract class SiperianClient
extends Object
    Primary API for sending requests to Siperian Hub using EJB, SOAP, or HTTP. For basic usage, you will not need to reference the subclass directly, but some provide extra features (for example, EJB transactions).

    To begin, create an instance using newSiperianClient(java.util.Properties). Depending on the properties, this will return a subclass for a particular protocol (EJB, SOAP, or HTTP). Then, you create and populate subclasses of SiperianRequest, call process(SiperianRequest), and SiperianResponses will be returned, or an exception will be thrown. You should cast the SiperianResponse to the concrete class corresponding to the request. For examples, see the sample code in any subclass of SiperianRequest.

    Warning: Instances are not thread-safe, so each thread (such as servlet request) in your application must use its own instance of SiperianClient. Since some clients can be expensive to create and connect, we recommend using one of these methods:

    • Use pooling for SiperianClient instances. Each thread must get its own from the pool. We recommend Apache Commons Pool.
    • Each thread must create its own SiperianClient instance. You might use ThreadLocal to hold the instance for multiple uses.
    • Synchronizing on a single instance of SiperianClient is not recommended because it will make your code single-threaded.
    The instances may be constructed from the same Properties or File, but note they will be sharing parameters such as username and orsId as specified by process(SiperianRequest). </p>

      • newSiperianClient

      • newSiperianClient

        public static SiperianClient newSiperianClient(Properties config)
        Create an instance of a subclass. Which subclass depends on the "siperian-client.protocol" property. Then, each subclass requires different properties. The instance returned is connected and ready for process(com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest).

        It is possible to extend this class, but this is only for advanced use, and there is no way to plug in to this factory method, so the constructor must be used.

        See also process(SiperianRequest) for how the Properties are used when processing a request.

        Returns:
        Never null .
        Throws:
        com.siperian.common.SipRuntimeException

      • process

        public final SiperianResponse process(SiperianRequest request)
        Called to process a request.

        Automatically calls setProperties(Properties, SiperianRequest) with the Properties used to create this SiperianClient to set the username, password, and orsId to the request if they are not already set. Warning: You should not have these values set in the Properties if the SiperianClient instance may be used by different users or for different ORS.

        Parameters:
        request - Request objects derived from SiperianRequest.
        Returns:
        SiperianResponse if the request was processed successfully.
        Throws:
        SiperianServerException - if the request processing fails.

      • setSecurityPayloadInRequest

        protected void setSecurityPayloadInRequest(SiperianRequest request)

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(Properties config,
                          SiperianRequest request)
        Used by process(SiperianRequest), this sets the username, password, and orsId to the request if they are not already set.

      • _process

        protected abstract SiperianResponse _process(SiperianRequest request)
        Sub-classes implement this method to handle request processing.
        Parameters:
        request - one of the request objects derived from SiperianRequest
        Returns:
        a SiperianResponse if the request was processed successfully
        Throws:
        SiperianServerException - if the request processing fails

        Returns:
        May be null.

        protected final String getConfigPropertyRequired(String key)

        Returns:
        never null
        Throws:
        SiperianClientException - if key not found in config
